intro: Prospero cudidaghense, commonly known as the Cudidagh endemic. It is a rare flowering plant native to the Cudidagh region of Madagascar. The plant features striking violet-blue petals with a contrasting yellow center. Its leaves are broad and lance-shaped, often covered in a fine, white绒毛. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is adapted to the unique microclimate of its habitat.
